message_1: Assuming that we are working with an elliptic curve defined by the equation y^2 = x^3 + 7x + 11 over a finite field F23, determine the points of the curve and compute the order of the group of points on the curve.
message_2:
To determine the points of the elliptic curve y^2 = x^3 + 7x + 11 over the finite field F23, we will iterate through all possible x and y values in the field and check if they satisfy the equation. The finite field F23 has elements {0, 1, 2, ..., 22}.

Points on the curve:
(We will use % to denote the modulo operation)

For each x in F23, calculate the right side of the equation (x^3 + 7x + 11) % 23 and check if there exists a y in F23 such that y^2 % 23 is equal to the calculated value.

Here are the points on the curve:

(0, 5), (0, 18)
(1, 7), (1, 16)
(2, 8), (2, 15)
(3, 10), (3, 13)
(4, 1), (4, 22)
(5, 6), (5, 17)
(6, 3), (6, 20)
(7, 12), (7, 11)
(9, 4), (9, 19)
(10, 14), (10, 9)
(12, 2), (12, 21)
(13, 6), (13, 17)
(15, 10), (15, 13)
(16, 5), (16, 18)
(17, 8), (17, 15)
(18, 7), (18, 16)
(19, 1), (19, 22)
(20, 12), (20, 11)
(21, 3), (21, 20)
(22, 4), (22, 19)

There are 29 points on the curve, including the point at infinity (denoted as O), which is always part of an elliptic curve group.

Thus, the order of the group of points on the curve is 30 (29 points on the curve + the point at infinity).
